newsitem.title: USA: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Markets in holiday mode.
newsitem.headline: U.S. bulk millfeeds - Markets in holiday mode.

text.p: Millfeed markets were quiet Friday because many dealers left work early ahead of the three-day U.S. Labor Day weekend.

Dealers who remained at their posts reported light market activity. Nearby supplies remained tight in the central United States, evidenced by the premium prices quoted for prompt shipped goods versus October-December positions.

Portland dealers said shippers sought rail cars of millfeed for shipment to Texas where higher prices may cover shipping costs. Portland feed was offered at $125 per ton for prompt shipment versus north Texas offers of $150.
The closely-watched Kansas City rail market was offered up $1.00 at $124 per ton, and bid $121.
